title: Tigers shut out Trout Lake, 5-0
text: Print this article Advertisement TROUT LAKE, Wash. — Prescott improved its season soccer record to 8-2 with a 5-0 shutout of Trout Lake here Friday. The Tigers got on the board halfway through the first half. Ricardo Flores found Luis Garcia and Garcia found the back of the net. The Tigers had all they would need with a 1-0 lead in the 20th minute. Three minutes later, it was Garcia doing the assisting and Jose Gonzalez doing the finishing for a 2-0 Tiger lead. The Tigers took a 2-0 lead to intermission. In the 41st minute, Flores found Gonzalez for his second goal of the night. The Tigers would add two more before the second half concluded. Flores got his second and third goals. His second coming in the 51st minute on a Gonzalez assist, and his hat-trick goal coming in the 73rd on an assist from Garcia. Oscar Garcia recorded the shutout in goal for the Tigers. Oscar Garcia had one save as the Tiger defense handled the Trout Lake attack and kept scoring chances to a minimum. “It’s nice to get a win on the road, especially on a long road trip,” Tiger coach Mark Grimm said. “We’ve been juggling our line up and it took us a while to get going. We got into a rhythm and got going and got a good win.” The Tigers host Irrigon Friday at 2 p.m. on the Prescott pitch. More like this story
